body: Hi all, I happened to find this fantastic cumulative solar radiation analysis done by Yazdani Studio of CannonDesign. I am wondering how this can be done in Grasshopper. Can anyone share personal experience? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KewsNm4bWJ4xPLltQaK3CWW9efI0gFozX4oHgbBvh*c8Ysdylab9e7gneV14ScnA5uFlspdb5uKCU72HrMjGlnllAWGeVHrG/Cumulativesolarradiationanalysis.jpg) Thanks in advance!

replies.body: Hey Mary, it is a custom made GH definition that uses analysis data from ecotect and maps it on a custom rad rose. He explains the concept [here](https://yazdanistudioresearch.wordpress.com/2013/01/13/a-new-way-of-visualizing-solar-radiation/#more-1021), but you won't fins a definition there XD, private intellectual property))

Hi Tim,



Thanks for your reply. I have gone through the article and got the basic idea. Maybe I will have a try to see whether can figure it out. :)

I'm not quite sure how informative this graph is but it's quite easy to generate it. Check the attached file. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/UNsexXQ7LVmX5gZon8D1asG4ZhM1KzNlamqY3SY-iWpVF8ly8CD9U4sAOzz8TlAF8*B-1Av*Hs8a*cjXHj*1IOcJGr6yo2Di/not_really_informative_graph.png)
